head.title: Personal Business; The Workstation As Archaeological Dig

hedline.hl1: Personal Business; The Workstation As Archaeological Dig

block.p: Corporate America may be moving toward the paperless office, but many employees are still caught up in the daily paper chase. Desks remain buried under mounds of files, books, newspapers and unopened mail. How does this cubicle chaos affect job performance, either yours or your employees'? And what mysteries have been solved when messy desks are finally cleared? Send your stories to On the Job, Money & Business, The New York Times, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959. E-mail: onthejob@nytimes.com. Include your name and telephone number. All submissions become the property of The Times and may be republished in any medium.
